page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Rams Hill House which at one time had a shop attached to it is now purely living accommodation Railway Line now disused The Paddock Wood to Horsmonden railway line opened in October 1892 and was used to bring the large numbers of hop pickers from London for the annual hop picking season and also for carrying the harvest of fruit and vegetables and plants to London The track has been removed over this section of the line but the old Railway Bridge is still standing in Swigs Hole Lane making a very imposing entrance to Swigs Hole Farm The track going back towards Rams Hill has been used as a refuse tip and only the road bridge is now visible although this does not go over anything
